parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
A guard, watch. Of Latin origin; 'custody', i.e. A Roman sentry.
Pilate. Of Latin origin; close-pressed, i.e. Firm; Pilatus, a Roman.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To say, declare. Properly, the same as the base of phos and phaino; to show or make known one's thoughts, i.e. Speak or say.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To go away, depart, begone, die. From hupo and ago; to lead under, i.e. Withdraw or retire, literally or figuratively.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Middle - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To make safe (secure, fast). From asphales; to render secure.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
